ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 1
ygData.msgSnippet: Grrrrrrrrr.  I ve been playing since Day one, and have noticed that most of the guys I work with have switched to female characters, supposedly because they
ygData.messageBody:
Grrrrrrrrr. I've been playing since Day one, and have noticed that most of the
guys I work with have switched to female characters, supposedly because they get
free stuff. I wasn't ever given (nor did I solicit any) stuff until I joined a
guild. Now, my brothers take care of me, but since I reciprocate, I feel it's
fair. Every time I see a "female" character (especially wood elves since I play
one) twinking, I /tell them....hehehe.......might not make me very popular but I
feel better at night. =)

Tara Lea wrote:

> From: Tara Lea <dactyl5@...>
>
> I was intrigued to see RPG weddings... I have a boyfriend in RL who plays a
> Barbarian Shaman at a higher level than myself, on the same server. So, I
> get some perks from that :) He normally plays from work with other friends
> and his brother, so it's like a close knit family. They just play the game,
> and that's what they are there for...hunting and quests, no on line
> relationships. I group with all males, which proves to be interesting.
> Flirting does take place and all members have significant others that do not
> play EQ... soon to be single with the way the are on all the time! I have
> been told most males will play female characters since they get more things
> and favors... I suppose I have noticed that. I love the game and find I
> look forward to going home from work to play... it's a whole other world!
>
> Hope to hear from y'all.
>
> -Aegea
>
> >From: Danette Barber <shardesane@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ_women@onelist.com
> >To: EQ_women@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 1
> >Date: Thu, 17 Jun 1999 05:58:26 GMT
> >MIME-Version: 1.0

> >1999
> >Received: (qmail 6802 invoked by alias); 17 Jun 1999 05:58:27 -0000
> >Received: (qmail 6797 invoked from network); 17 Jun 1999 05:58:27 -0000
> >Received: from unknown (HELO hotmail.com) (209.185.130.218) by
> >pop.onelist.com with SMTP; 17 Jun 1999 05:58:27 -0000
> >Received: (qmail 70049 invoked by uid 0); 17 Jun 1999 05:58:27 -0000
> >Message-ID: <19990617055827.70048.qmail@...>
> >Received: from 24.234.19.236 by www.hotmail.com with HTTP; Wed, 16 Jun 1999
> >22:58:26 PDT
> >X-Originating-IP: [24.234.19.236]
> >Mailing-List: list EQ_women@onelist.com; contact EQ_women-owner@onelist.com
> >Delivered-To: mailing list EQ_women@onelist.com
> >Precedence: bulk
> >List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:EQ_women-unsubscribe@...>
> >
> >From: Danette Barber <shardesane@...>
> >
> >Hello All,
> >
> > I have lot of different characters, but my two main ones are Dyrlia
> >RaverSong, a level 24 bearded Dwarven Cleric on Innoruuk server, and
> >Dandara, a level 13 Human ShadowKnight on Cazic-Thule server.
> >
> > I have never been asked if I am a woman in real life, which I find rather
> >odd, but count my blessings for. I'm sure it will happen someday, but it
> >hasn't so far. (Crosses fingers).
> >
> > As far as flirting goes, I am a notorious flirt and I'll flirt with
> >anyone
> >at any time. That's the way I am in real life, so I guess I can't help it
> >in
> >EQ. I think human interaction is one of the best parts of the game, and
> >flirtation is one of the oldest of human interactions <grin>. If you and
> >those you do it with enjoy it, by all means have fun with it.
> >
> > The thing that irks me to no end (and I'll be honest here and admit that
> >I
> >believe most of these "women" to be played by men)is the female characters
> >that you see once in awhile that shout something to the effect of "I'm a
> >cute, helpless, sexy, level four wood elf and I want someone to give me,
> >for
> >free, an item or ten obtainable only by a full-group of level 40+ people.
> >*bats eyelashes*." I'm not saying its wrong or that they should be shunned
> >on site. I'm not even sure exactly why it bothers me, but its incredibly
> >annoying. Maybe it's because I feel like they are taking advantage of male
> >hormones, and I don't feel right doing that so I'm jealous <G>. Dandara did
> >ask someone of higher level once to bring her back an ice goblin from
> >Permafrost, but I don't exactly see that as being the same thing.
> >
> >Cheers,
> >
> >Danette
> >
> >
> >
